Description: Fragment of fattened handle of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora, gradual curve. Clay fine light red-brown; cream slip. Circular stamp with Greek inscription.
Curator's comments: Petrie Diary 1884-5 (EES Archive XVII 47) p. 163, 30. Name Mytion. From very similar die to that of Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, ABC 0171.17.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0595)
